ingredients: salmon, lemon, garlic, dill, butter
cooking_instructions:
Ingredients:
Salmon fillets (skin-on or skinless): 4 pieces (about 6 oz each)
Lemon (zested and juiced): 1
Garlic (minced): 3 cloves
Fresh dill (chopped): 2 tbsp
Butter (melted): 3 tbsp
Salt and pepper: to taste
Steps:
1:Prepare the Butter Mixture: In a small bowl, mix together melted butter, lemon juice, lemon zest, minced garlic, chopped dill, salt, and pepper.
2:Preheat and Prepare the Salmon: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Place the salmon fillets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
3:Coat the Salmon: Pour the prepared lemon dill butter mixture over the salmon fillets, ensuring they are evenly coated.
4:Bake: Bake the salmon in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until it flakes easily with a fork and reaches an internal temperature of 145°F (63°C).
5:Serve: Garnish with extra fresh dill and lemon slices before serving. Enjoy your Lemon Dill Butter Salmon!

ingredients: chicken, yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, garam masala, turmeric powder, chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, salt, vegetable oil, onion, tomato, fresh cilantro leaves
cooking_instructions:
Ingredients:
Chicken (cut into pieces): 1 lb (450 g)
Yogurt: 1/2 cup (120 g)
Ginger-garlic paste: 1 tbsp
Garam masala: 1 tsp
Turmeric powder: 1/2 tsp
Chili powder: 1 tsp
Cumin powder: 1 tsp
Coriander powder: 1 tsp
Salt: to taste
Vegetable oil: 2 tbsp
Onion (finely chopped): 1 large
Tomato (pureed): 1 medium
Fresh cilantro leaves (for garnish): a handful
Steps:
1:Prepare the Marinade: In a bowl, combine the chicken pieces with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, garam masala, turmeric, chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well and marinate for at least 30 minutes.
2:Cook the Onions: Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown, about 5-7 minutes.
3:Add the Tomatoes: Stir in the pureed tomato and cook for 5 minutes, until the oil starts to separate from the mixture.
4:Add the Chicken: Add the marinated chicken to the pan and cook for 8-10 minutes, until the chicken is browned on all sides.
5:Simmer the Curry: Add a little water (about 1/2 cup) to make the gravy and bring it to a simmer. Cook for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is fully cooked and tender.
6:Garnish and Serve: Garnish the curry with fresh cilantro leaves and serve with rice or naan. Enjoy your homemade Chicken Curry!

ingredients: basmati rice, water, ghee, cinnamon stick, green cardamom pods, cloves, bay leaf, salt
cooking_instructions:
Ingredients:
Basmati rice: 1 cup (200 g)
Water: 2 cups (480 ml)
Ghee: 2 tbsp
Cinnamon stick: 1-inch piece
Green cardamom pods: 2
Cloves: 2-3
Bay leaf: 1
Salt: to taste
Steps:
1:Rinse and Soak Rice: Rinse the basmati rice thoroughly under cold water until the water runs clear. Soak for 20-30 minutes and drain.
2:Heat Spices in Ghee: In a large pan, heat the ghee over medium heat. Add the cinnamon stick, cardamom pods, cloves, and bay leaf, and sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
3:Cook the Rice: Add the soaked rice to the pan and sauté for 2-3 minutes, ensuring the rice is well-coated with the ghee and spices.
4:Add Water and Salt: Pour in the water and add salt. Bring it to a boil, then reduce the heat, cover the pan, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, until the rice is cooked and the water is absorbed.
5:Fluff and Serve: Remove the bay leaf and whole spices. Fluff the rice with a fork and serve your aromatic Indian Pulao as a side dish or main meal.

ingredients: lentils, water, vegetable oil, onion, garlic, ginger, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, chili powder, salt, fresh cilantro leaves
cooking_instructions:
Ingredients:
Lentils: 1 cup (200 g) (yellow or red lentils work well)
Water: 4 cups (960 ml)
Vegetable oil: 2 tbsp
Onion: 1 medium, finely chopped
Garlic: 4 cloves, minced
Ginger: 1-inch piece, grated
Cumin seeds: 1 tsp
Turmeric powder: 1/2 tsp
Chili powder: 1 tsp (adjust to taste)
Salt: to taste
Fresh cilantro leaves: a handful, chopped (for garnish)
Steps:
1:Cook Lentils: Rinse the lentils under cold water. In a pot, bring the lentils and water to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 25-30 minutes, or until the lentils are soft and fully cooked.
2:Prepare Tempering: While the lentils cook, heat the vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds, and sauté until they start to splutter, about 30 seconds.
3:Sauté Onion, Garlic, and Ginger: Add the chopped onion to the pan and sauté until golden brown, about 5-6 minutes. Then, add the garlic and ginger, and cook for another 2 minutes until fragrant.
4:Add Spices: Stir in the turmeric powder and chili powder, and cook for 1-2 minutes to release their flavors.
5:Combine and Simmer: Add the cooked lentils to the pan, mix well, and add salt to taste. Simmer for 5-10 minutes, allowing the flavors to blend together.
6:Garnish and Serve: Garnish the dal with fresh chopped cilantro and serve hot with rice or flatbread.

ingredients: chickpeas, onion, garlic, ginger, tomatoes, garam masala, turmeric powder, chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, salt, vegetable oil, fresh cilantro leaves
cooking_instructions:
Ingredients:
Chickpeas: 1 can (15 oz) or 1.5 cups dried, soaked overnight
Onion: 1 medium, finely chopped
Garlic: 4 cloves, minced
Ginger: 1-inch piece, grated
Tomatoes: 2 medium, chopped (or 1 can of diced tomatoes)
Garam masala: 1 tsp
Turmeric powder: 1/2 tsp
Chili powder: 1 tsp (adjust to taste)
Cumin powder: 1 tsp
Coriander powder: 1 tsp
Salt: to taste
Vegetable oil: 2 tbsp
Fresh cilantro leaves: a handful, chopped (for garnish)
Steps:
1:Sauté Onion, Garlic, and Ginger: Heat the vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until golden brown, about 5-6 minutes. Add minced garlic and grated ginger, cooking for another 2 minutes until fragrant.
2:Add Tomatoes and Spices: Stir in chopped tomatoes, garam masala, turmeric, chili powder, cumin, and coriander powder. Cook for 5-7 minutes until the tomatoes soften and the spices release their aroma.
3:Add Chickpeas: Add the cooked or canned chickpeas to the pan, along with a little water if the curry is too thick. Stir to coat the chickpeas with the spices, then simmer for 10-15 minutes to allow the flavors to blend.
4:Season and Garnish: Add salt to taste, and cook for an additional 5 minutes. Garnish with freshly chopped cilantro leaves before serving.
5:Serve: Serve hot with rice, naan, or roti for a complete meal.

ingredients: potatoes, cauliflower, peas, vegetable oil, cumin seeds, ginger, garlic, green chili peppers, turmeric powder, chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, salt, fresh cilantro leaves
cooking_instructions:
Ingredients:
Potatoes: 2 medium, peeled and cut into cubes
Cauliflower: 1 small head, cut into florets
Peas: 1/2 cup (fresh or frozen)
Vegetable oil: 2 tbsp
Cumin seeds: 1 tsp
Ginger: 1-inch piece, grated
Garlic: 4 cloves, minced
Green chili peppers: 1-2, slit (optional, adjust for spice level)
Turmeric powder: 1/2 tsp
Chili powder: 1 tsp (adjust to taste)
Cumin powder: 1 tsp
Coriander powder: 1 tsp
Garam masala: 1 tsp
Salt: to taste
Fresh cilantro leaves: a handful, chopped (for garnish)
Steps:
1:Sauté Spices and Aromatics: Heat the vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and cook until they splutter. Add ginger, garlic, and green chilies, sautéing for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.
2:Cook Potatoes and Cauliflower: Add the cubed potatoes and cauliflower florets to the pan. Stir to coat the vegetables with the spices and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
3:Add Spices: Sprinkle turmeric, chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt over the vegetables. Stir well and cook for 10-12 minutes, allowing the potatoes and cauliflower to soften and absorb the spices.
4:Add Peas and Simmer: Add peas and a splash of water if needed to prevent sticking. Cover the pan and cook for another 5-7 minutes until the vegetables are tender and cooked through.
5:Finish and Garnish: Sprinkle garam masala over the cooked vegetables and stir to combine. Garnish with freshly chopped cilantro leaves before serving.
6:Serve: Serve hot with rice, naan, or roti for a complete vegetarian meal.

ingredients: paneer, onion, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, garam masala, turmeric powder, chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, salt, vegetable oil, fresh cilantro leaves
cooking_instructions:
Ingredients:
Paneer (cottage cheese): 250g, cut into cubes
Onion: 1 medium, finely chopped
Tomatoes: 2 medium, pureed
Ginger: 1-inch piece, grated
Garlic: 4 cloves, minced
Garam masala: 1 tsp
Turmeric powder: 1/2 tsp
Chili powder: 1 tsp (adjust to taste)
Cumin powder: 1 tsp
Coriander powder: 1 tsp
Salt: to taste
Vegetable oil: 2 tbsp
Fresh cilantro leaves: a handful, chopped (for garnish)
Steps:
1:Sauté Onions and Spices: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden. Then add ginger, garlic, and cook until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
2:Cook Tomatoes and Spices: Add pureed tomatoes to the pan. Stir in garam masala, turmeric, chili powder, cumin, coriander powder, and salt. Cook until the oil starts to separate from the masala, about 5-7 minutes.
3:Add Paneer: Gently add the paneer cubes to the cooked masala mixture. Stir carefully to coat the paneer with the spices.

ingredients: shrimp, onion, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, garam masala, turmeric powder, chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, salt, vegetable oil, fresh cilantro leaves

ingredients: fish fillets, turmeric powder, chili powder, cumin powder, salt, vegetable oil, onion, ginger, garlic, tomatoes, green chili peppers, fresh cilantro leaves

ingredients: potatoes, green peas, vegetable oil, cumin seeds, ginger, green chili peppers, turmeric powder, chili powder, cumin powder, salt, fresh cilantro leaves

ingredients: okra, vegetable oil, cumin seeds, onion, ginger, garlic, turmeric powder, chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, salt, fresh cilantro leaves

ingredients: eggplant, vegetable oil, cumin seeds, onion, ginger, garlic, tomatoes, turmeric powder, chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, salt, fresh cilantro leaves
cooking_instructions:

ingredients: chicken, rice flour, cornstarch, ginger-garlic paste, soy sauce, red chili flakes, vegetable oil, onion, bell peppers, green chili peppers, fresh cilantro leaves
cooking_instructions:
Ingredients:
Chicken: 500g, boneless, cut into bite-sized pieces
Rice flour: 2 tbsp (for coating)

Ginger-garlic paste: 2 tsp
Soy sauce: 3 tbsp (divided)

Creates a crunchy base for the dish.
3:Sauté Vegetables: In the same pan, heat a little oil and stir-fry onion, bell peppers, and green chilies until slightly tender.
Provides a flavorful, colorful base.

Combines the spicy-saucy flavors.
5:Garnish and Serve: Sprinkle fresh cilantro leaves and serve hot with fried rice or noodles.
Completes the dish with a fresh touch.

ingredients: potatoes, vegetable oil, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, chili powder, salt, fresh cilantro leaves

ingredients: spinach, garlic, ginger, green chili peppers, garam masala, salt, vegetable oil, fresh lemon juice

ingredients: rice vermicelli, vegetable oil, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, urad dal, chana dal, dried red chili peppers, curry leaves, onion, green beans, carrot, green peas, turmeric powder, salt, fresh cilantro leaves
